name: basic-memory
description: Local-first knowledge management with AI integration
long_description: Basic Memory is a local-first knowledge management system that creates a personal knowledge graph from markdown files. It enables bidirectional communication between LLMs and your local knowledge base through the Model Context Protocol (MCP), allowing AI assistants to read, write, and navigate your knowledge seamlessly.

tools.name: write_note
tools.description: Create or update markdown notes with semantic structure

tools.name: read_note
tools.description: Read notes by title, permalink, or memory:// URL

tools.name: read_content
tools.description: Read raw file content (text, images, binaries)

tools.name: build_context
tools.description: Navigate knowledge graph via memory:// URLs

tools.name: canvas
tools.description: Generate Obsidian canvas files for knowledge visualization

prompts.name: continue_conversation
prompts.description: Continue previous conversations with relevant historical context
prompts.text: Continue our conversation about {{topic}} from {{timeframe}} ago. Use the continue_conversation tool to find relevant context and build on our previous discussion.

prompts.name: search_notes
prompts.description: Search knowledge base with detailed, formatted results
prompts.text: Search my knowledge base for information about {{query}}. Use the search_notes tool to find relevant notes and provide a comprehensive summary of what I know about this topic.

prompts.name: recent_activity
prompts.description: View recently changed items with formatted output
prompts.text: Show me what I've been working on recently in the past {{timeframe}}. Use the recent_activity tool to display my recent notes and changes.
